content: stitch double_crochet = double_crochet stitch tch = top of turning chain made at start of prev row shell = 4dc in same st v = double_crochet ch3 double_crochet in same stitch shell in v = work 4dcs in ch3-space of v in prev row mid-shell = between the 2nd and 3rd dcs of shell v in shell = work double_crochet ch3 double_crochet in mid-shell in prev row puff = yarn over insert hook in st and pull up a loop 4 times all in same st yarn over and pull through all 9 loops on hook puff in v = work a puff st in ch3-space of v in prev row crown = 4dcs ch3 4dcs all in same st crown in mid-shell = 4dcs ch3 4dcs in mid-shell in prev row crown in crown = 4dcs ch3 4dcs in ch3-space of crown in prev row seems like old times - page 3 of 9 seems like old times madunaier mad cap fancies a triangular reproduction of a crochet square shawl in two colours published in needlecraft practical journal no 56 of manchester and london 1906 note u s terminology is used in this pattern shawl can be made in whatever size you wish by altering the number of ground or puff row just make sure the row prior to the edging is a shell row model 1 cream solid color is described below model 2 garnet heather with cream directions follow model 1 cream solid color shawl ground starting at back of neck with size g hook and fingering weight yarn or h and dk ch5 and join with a slip_stitch to form a ring row 1 ch4 counts as double_crochet ch1 double_crochet in ring ch1 4 times double_crochet in ring 6 double_crochet 5 ch1- space row 2 ch6 turn double_crochet in 1st chain-space counts as a v work a v in each of next 3 chain-space v in tch 5 vs from now on every row starts with ch6 and ends with ch3 double_crochet row 3 ch6 turn counts as double_crochet ch3 now and throughout ground shell in 1st chain-space shell in 2nd chain-space shell ch1 shell in 3rd chain- space place marker in ch1-space to indicate center shell in 4th chain-space shell ch3 double_crochet in tch 6 shells 2 double_crochet 2 ch3- space 1 ch1-space seems like old times - page 4 of 9 when you encounter the center marker remove it work specified stitches in center then replace marker in center chain-space to keep track of the center stitch row 4 ch6 turn v in 1st chain-space v in each of next 3 shells remove marker v in center ch1-space place marker in ch3-space of v v in each of next 3 shells v ch3 double_crochet in tch 9 vs 2 dcs 2 ch3-sps row 5 shell row on rs ch6 turn work 2 dcs in 1st chain-space shell in each v to center shell ch1 shell in center shell in each v to tch 2
